raw_text:
Hundreds vie for best film Oscar
 
 A total of 267 films are eligible for the best film Oscar but only five will be chosen to go forward as nominees.
 
 The Academy of Motion Picture, Arts and Sciences has sent out the first ballot papers with the full list of films vying for recognition. Among those expected to receive nominations are The Aviator, Million Dollar Baby and Sideways. Academy members will now vote for their favourites before the final nominees are announced on 25 January.
 
 To be eligible for nomination a film must have been shown in a commercial theatre for seven consecutive days before the deadline of 31 December. Director Martin Scorsese's The Aviator, starring Leonardo DiCaprio went on general release on Christmas Day in the US, ensuring it just made the deadline. Studios have already begun lobbying voters, taking out full page adverts in trade publications such as Variety urging them to remember particular films when it comes to choosing what to back. Other movies tipped for possible success include Closer, starring Jude Law and Julia Roberts, Finding Neverland, with Johnny Depp as author JM Barry and Kinsey starring Liam Neeson as the famed sex scientist Alfred Kinsey. Meanwhile, design engineer Takuo Miyagishima will be awarded an Oscar at the Scientific and Technical Awards Dinner on 12 February 2005. Miyagishima is the 18th recipient of the Sawyer Award, which is "presented to an individual in the motion picture industry whose technological contributions have brought credit to the industry." The main Oscar ceremony will be held in Los Angeles on 27 February.

tinyllama:1.1b: As per the given text, a total of 267 films are eligible for the best film Oscar but only five (5) will be chosen as nominations from among them.

Among those expected to receive nominations include "The Aviator," directed by Martin Scorsese, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, which hit general release on Christmas Day in the US; "The Aviator" is one of several Oscar-ticket-holding movies that studios have been lobbying voters to consider when choosing what to back.
Other Oscar-calibre films included "Close," starring Julia Roberts and Johnny Depp, and "Findings Neverland," featuring Kate Hudson as the author of renowned sex scientist Alfred Kinsey.
Design engineer Takuo Miyaigishima will be honoured with a Sawyser Award at the upcoming Scientific and Technical Awards Dinner on 12 February.
The main Oscar ceremony will be held in Los Angeles on 27 February.
tinydolphin:1.1b:
Summary: 
Hundreds of films from around the world are vying for the prestigious title of best film at the 8th Academy Awards, with only five being chosen to advance as nominees.

This process is conducted by the Academy of Motion Picture, Arts and Sciences to honor movies that have showcased their artistry and creativity on the big screen, making it a highly anticipated event in the film industry.
This year's line-up includes some major favorites such as The Aviator directed by Martin Scorsese starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Sideways starring Angelina Jolie and Win Win star Thomas Haden.

In addition to these top contenders, other notable films mentioned include Closer starring Julia Roberts and Jude Law, Finding Neverland with Johnny Depp portraying the famous sex scientist Alfred Kinsey, and design engineer Takuo Miyagishima receiving an Oscar at the Scientific and Technical Awards Dinner.
